{"step_by_step_thinking": "Infective endocarditis is an infection of the inner surface of the heart, usually the valves. The documents do not specify that it is most commonly seen in ASD, VSD, PDA, or Pulmonary stenosis. However, Document [1] and Document [4] mention that risk factors for infective endocarditis include valvular heart disease, congenital heart disease, artificial valves, hemodialysis, intravenous drug use, and electronic pacemakers. Among the options, ASD (Atrial Septal Defect), VSD (Ventricular Septal Defect), and PDA (Patent Ductus Arteriosus) are types of congenital heart diseases.
